Patch.name: (#+1%) Chance of Critical Hit
Patch.Description: Example: Using 63 (decimal: 99) would be 99% + 1% resulting in 100% Critical hit rate.

Patch.name: (#+1%) Chance of Knockback for Dash/Throw Stone
Patch.Description: Example: Using 63 (decimal: 99) would be 99% + 1% resulting in 100% Knockback for Dash/Throw Stone.

Patch.name: (#+1%) Chance of Spell/Skill Proc (Formula 02)
Patch.Description: Example: Using 63 (decimal: 99) would be 99% + 1% resulting in 100% Spell Proc Rate.

Patch.name: X% chance of Critical Hit v2
X% chance of Knockback for Dash/Throw Stone v2
Patch.Description: NOTE: The chance of Knockback IS NOT 50%. That's an error in the BMG. The probability of knockback is actually (CasBr) / (CasBr + TarBr).

Patch.name: 2nd Squad is not mandatory
Patch.Description: Allows starting a battle with an empty 2nd Squad, even if you have units available.

Patch.name: Activate Paletted Portraits for Special Units
Patch.Description: Allows use of additional palettes on unique portraits for battles and events.

Patch.name: Allow generics to join as guests (version 1)
Patch.Description: The number of the guest is that of the roster number. For example, Sprite Set 0x10 (17) with Load Formation will load unit 17 in roster.

Patch.name: Blank support ability over Short Charge adds 25% bonus skill hit
Patch.Description: Abilities like talk skill, spells, physical abilities gain 25% to hit unless they are 100% to hit to start with.

Patch.name: Blank support ability over Short Charge adds 25% bonus skill hit V2
Patch.Description: Abilities like talk skill, spells, physical abilities gain 25% to hit unless they are 100% to hit to start with.

Patch.name: Brave becomes Fury (Version 1.02)
Patch.Description:
Fury is essentially Brave, but with Faith's aspects. The higher your Fury, the higher damage you can deal and receive.
The formula added at the end of all calculations is: (40+Caster_Fury)* (40+Target_Fury)*Total_Damage/10000
Basically 72 Fury will make your hits will be at 112% strength as well as your damage received.
Fury still keeps Brave's normal effects such as Move-Find Item and chance to activate reaction abilities.
Bye Bye constant damage! Zodiac compatibility doesn't affect nearly as much as this anyway.

Patch.name: Brave becomes Fury (Version 1.1)
Patch.Description: Fury is essentially Brave, but with Faith's aspects. The higher your Fury, the higher damage you can deal and receive. The formula added at the end of all calculations is: (X+Caster_Fury)*(Y+Target_Fury)*Total_Damage/10000 Fury still keeps Brave's normal effects such as Move-Find Item and chance to activate reaction abilities. Bye Bye constant damage! Zodiac compatibility doesn't affect nearly as much as this anyway.

Patch.name: Can view ??? units' stats
Patch.Description: Allows viewing the stats of ??? units. Sadly, as the Unit List does not have a function to hide stats like the battle field does, you should not apply the Unit List portion of this hack if you want stats to remain completely hidden to the player. This means the ??? unit will not show up at all in the Unit List, just like in the original version. By default, this xml disables all stats hiding, so edit it as you see fit (there are plenty of comments).

Patch.name: Cross Skip v3
Patch.Description: Holding X (Cross button), will fly you through dialog text as if you were mashing the button.

Patch.name: Change DMG_(MA+Y)/2 * MA to Dmg_(MA*Y) for formula 1E/1F/5E/5F/60
Custom Palette for Special Units and Generic Humans
Patch.Description: Allows use of additional palettes on unique and generic sprites for battles and events.

Patch.name: Custom Palette for Special Units, Generic Humans and Generic Monsters
Patch.Description: Allows use of additional palettes on unique, generic and monster sprites for battles and events.

Patch.name: Disable the game music
Patch.Description: Disables all in-game music.

Patch.name: Divide Bonus Money by 2
Patch.Description: Divide Bonus Money received at the end of a battle by 2.

Patch.name: Divide Gained EXP in 2 (Version 1)
Patch.Description:
Divines EXP gained in half and also breaks minimal 1 Exp gain on success.
NOTE: BUGGY; Exp gain works fine but amount gained with the Display Exp and JP gain option, it calculates normally and doesn't halve.

Patch.name: Elemental Fix (v3) FIXES HOLY SWORD AND OIL
Patch.Description: Strengthen is W / 128 * Damage Absorb is X / 128 * Damage Resist is Y / 128 * Damage Weak is Z / 128 * Damage NOTE: The above are to final damage. This means the round-off errors are minimized compared to FFT. A list of common percentages: 190% is F4 183% is EB 180% is E7 175% is E0 170% is DA 166% is D6 160% is CD 150% is C0 140% is B4 133% is AB 130% is A7 125% is A0 120% is 9A 117% is 96 110% is 8D 100% is 80 90% is 74 83% is 6B 80% is 67 75% is 60 70% is 5A 66% is 56 60% is 4D 50% is 40 40% is 34 33% is 2B 30% is 27 25% is 20 20% is 1A 17% is 16 10% is D If the ability has "Weapon Strike", the ability will stack both the elementals from the weapons and from the ability. A consequence of this is that the first attack in FFTP must now be flagged as weapon strike or elemental weapons will not work. If you want to only use the ability elemental, unflag "Weapon Strike". If you want to only use the weapon elemental, flag "Weapon Strike" and set the ability as non-elemental. This hack also bundles the Float = Weak to Wind hack. If you don't want this feature, don't change 11FD48 or 11FD54.

Patch.name: Equip Change Fix
Patch.Description: Allows changing your Right Hand/Left Hand equipments without consuming your Act.

Patch.name: Event Instruction Upgrade v1.13
Patch.Description: Upgrades InflictStatus(), Allows editing more variables and Adds many instructions to use in events, such as: BlockLoop(), LUI(), SET(), Random(), LoadAddress(), UnitAddress(), WorldUnitAddress(), SaveAddress(), UpdateUnit(), MinMax() and Routine(). Automatically recalculates the text offset when necessary removing the need to include a Text() offset for savestate eventing.

Patch.name: Formula 1E (Truth Skillset) becomes Dmg_(MA*Y) #Hit(Rdm{1,X})
Patch.Description: Formula 1E - Dmg_((MA+Y)*MA/2) #Hit(Rdm(1,X)) becomes Formula 1E - Dmg_(MA*Y) #Hit(Rdm{1,X})

Patch.name: Force Recover HP on Crystal
Patch.Description: Recover HP/MP will automatically selected upon stepping on a crystal. You will not be able to learn abilities from crystals.

Patch.name: Frameskipper v1.1
Patch.Description:
When pressing the designed controller input combinations, the frame limiter will be switched on/off. (Default: L2+Square = on / R2+Square = off) The last option is: "Turn off frameskip as soon as I stop holding the ON: Button Combination".
0x8000 Left 0x4000 Down 0x2000 Right 0x1000 Up 0x0800 Start 0x0400 R3 0x0200 L3 0x0100 Select 0x0080 Square 0x0040 Cross 0x0020 Circle 0x0010 Triangle 0x0008 R1 0x0004 L1 0x0002 R2 0x0001 L2

Patch.name: Fur Shop Town Availability
Patch.Description:
Enables the Fur Shop option in specified towns. (Default: Dorter, Warjilis, Zarghidas)
X: 0x01: Lesalia Imperial Capital 0x02: Riovanes Castle 0x04: Igros Castle 0x08: Lionel Castle 0x10: Limberry Castle 0x20: Zeltennia Castle 0x40: Magic City Gariland 0x80: Yardow Fort City
Y: 0x01: Goland Coal City 0x02: Dorter Trade City 0x04: Zaland Fort City 0x08: Goug Machine City 0x10: Warjilis Trade City 0x20: Bervenia Free City 0x40: Zarghidas Trade City 0x80: Fort Zeakden
Z: 0x01: Murond Holy Place 0x02: Thieves Fort 0x04: Orbonne Monastery 0x08: Golgorand Execution Site 0x10: Murond Death City 0x20: Bethla Garrison 0x40: Deep Dungeon 0x80: Nelveska Temple

Patch.name: Global C-Ev
Patch.Description: All units will have 100% of their C-Ev. calculated for the front, 50% for the sides and 25% for the back.

Patch.name: Global C-Ev. (Version 2)
Patch.Description: All units will have 100% of their C-Evade calculated for the front, 50% for the sides and 25% for the back.

Patch.name: Guests in Randoms & Unit Restrictions
Patch.Description: Allows you to bring uncontrollable guests into battle, and allows you to choose which units can not be added to the squad formation screen depending on the given event.

Patch.name: Incremental Jump Range
Patch.Description:
Instead of choosing the highest value of the learned jump ability for the horizontal/vertical ranges, instead they are added all together, meaning no one skill is ever going to be useless; it will always count towards your total horizontal/vertical range. You could have Horizontal +2, Horizontal +1, Horizontal + 1, together would be the equivalent of Horizontal +4.
Vertical Numbers are times two, because in hex, 0.5 height = 1 hex. So, entering 0014 (0x0014), would be the equivalent of 10 height (decimal).

Patch.name: Item required to use skills using the 'Materia Blade' boolean
Patch.Description: Use the Item ID you want to use the 'Materia Blade' boolean.

Patch.name: Mime functions as normal Job (v2)
Patch.Description: Mime still can't learn abilities, but otherwise, they should be perfectly normal. If you want mimes to still mimic, delete the last line (11BF44).

Patch.name: Monster Skill is disabled
Patch.Description: All monsters can use their 4 skills as if Monster Skill never existed. Also frees space from 0x80182438 to 0x80182660 (BATTLE.BIN).

Patch.name: Move-Find Item is Player only
Patch.Description: Only a unit from the player's team can pick up items through Move-Find Item.

Patch.name: num of allowed spritesheets
Patch.Description: This one is risky if you aren't aware of the consequences. Normally the spritesheet limit is 9 and the game will always calculate that you bring 5 units in random battles, even if the squad allows less. Therefore the game will calculate that only 4 enemy spritesheets are allowed to be loaded and will not even try to load any different spritesheet units after that. By raising the limit to 13, it allows 8 enemy spritesheets. Whoever you have to make sure the amount of units the player is allowed in the squad plus the the total spritesheets the ENTD can generate doesn't exceed 9. Else you create the possibility that a graphical glitch will occur for some units just like in story battles or the Deep Dungeon.

Patch.name: Number of Maximum palettes that can be used
Patch.Description:
Allows you to increase the maximum amount of useable palettes to 8.
NOTE: A crystal from palette 6 will crash the game and 6-8 use a glitchy palette for treasure/crystal/frog/chicken.

Patch.name: Propositions Hack 2.1
Patch.Description:
Proposition Hack v2 with Gil Cost and the ability to abandon marks. By Xifanie (a bit of help from Pride's original hack)
This hack involves a few more steps than most and it should really only be used if you know what you are doing. This is the hack that is used for the 'Marks' System in Jot5.
This will allow you to unlock a Proposition based on Story Progress rather than Shop Progress. It also changes how propositions work.
First you will want to go to the propositions tab in FFTP. Since this hack changes Propositions to use Story Progress you'll have to either count out the entries to find the correct number or you can rename your shop progress to also include story progress, as I have in the picture here: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/53561892/Xif%20ASM%20Description%20Images/Prop%20Hack%20Image%201.png Once this is setup, you can check your game and upon reaching the set story progress, the Proposition should unlock in the Bar as normal. You will NOT be prompted to send out units or select an amount of days for the job. Instead you will be told the job details as normal (These are edited in section 2 of WLDMES.BIN) and you can choose to accept or decline. If you decline the listing remains posted. If you accept then the listing disappears and the variable for the Proposition is set to 2. The variables for Propositions with this hack work as follows:
0 = Repeat 2 = Started, can call back 4 = Completed
The next thing you would do would be to edit your worldmap conditions to include something like this on the location where you want the Mark/Proposition Event to take place: 010066030200190013010100
What this breaks down to is: IF - Variable 366 = 2 - Run Event 113 - Agressively
NOTE: Variable 366 is the Variable for Envoy ship, Falcon one of the vanilla propositions, and is just an example here. Same with event 113, as it is what I chose to use for this example. Also, the 0100 - Agressively is when you step on a dot and it takes you to a battle, it does the swirl image thing, in comparison to having this set to 0200 - Calmly, which would be the fade out you'd get if you were instead being taken to a non battle cutscene.
So now, in this example, once you accept the job and walk onto the location you put the code on in the worldmap, the battle/scene will start.
VERY IMPORTANT: At the end of the scene or battle you also need to either change the Propositions variable to either 0 or 4. If you set it to 0, the Proposition will appear back in the Bar and can be repeated. If you set it to 4, the Proposition will be flagged as completed and a bravestory entry will be added to the bravestory. Make sure you don't leave the variable as 2, because the battle will repeat everytime you try to leave the dot on the map. Here's an example of what you'd want at the end of your event to mark the proposition as complete: ZERO(x0366) ADD(x0366,x0004)
You can also cancel a Proposition in case you want to pass a spot on the map due to a Proposition battle being too difficult or just wanting to put it off for later. Cancelled jobs will reappear the next time you enter the bar.

Patch.name: Raise Palette Limit
Patch.Description:
Allows use of all 8 palettes on Spritesheets.
NOTE: A crystal from palette 6 will crash the game and 6-8 use a glitchy palette for treasure/crystal/frog/chicken.

Patch.name: Ramza (unit ID 01,02 and 03) can join as a Guest.
Patch.Description: Allows Ramza to join as a guest under normal guest joining conditions.

Patch.name: Remove forced slowdown for Math Skill (Skillset ID 0x15)
Patch.Description: Removes the slowdown associated with skillset x15, which is the Math Skillset in Vanilla.

Patch.name: Removes permanent brave alteration. (version 2.0)
Patch.Description: Brave alterations both positive and negative are not retained after the battle ends.

Patch.name: Removes permanent faith alteration. (version 2.0)
Patch.Description: Faith alterations both positive and negative are not retained after the battle ends.

Patch.name: Rumors use proposition space
Patch.Description: Rumors use proposition completion notes slots based on town ID

Patch.name: Selling items at Any Shop costs 1/4 normal price
Patch.Description: Sell items to the store at 1/4 the retail price.

Patch.name: Sets the title screens default option from New Game to Continue
Smart Encounters
Patch.Description: 100% random encounter on destination, 0% otherwise. So you ONLY get random encounters when you want them.

Patch.name: Spell quotes always pop up
Patch.Description: Spell quotes will always pop up on spells that have quotes.

Patch.name: Skillset X innate all
Patch.Description: For this hack to work, X must equal Y. This also makes it so the AI controlled monsters can use secondary skillsets. However, the AI can only consider up to 32 moves, so if the primary and secondary have too many moves, the innate skillset's moves will still be ignored by the AI. A list of skillsets: 01 : Attack 02 : Defend 03 : Equip Change 04 : 05 : Basic Skill / Fundaments 06 : Item / Items 07 : Battle Skill / Arts of War 08 : Charge / Aim 09 : Punch Art / Martial Arts 0A : White Magic / White Magicks 0B : Black Magic / Black Magicks 0C : Time Magic / Time Magicks 0D : Summon Magic / Summon 0E : Steal 0F : Talk Skill / Speechcraft 10 : Yin Yang Magic / Mystic Arts 11 : ONLY (Huntcraft)

Patch.name: Stat gain/break cap + Maintenance prevents stat break
Patch.Description: For example, a lower limit of 1/3 and a upper limit of 1/4 for someone with 18PA, would be: lower cap: 18PA - (18PA * 1/3) = 12PA upper cap: 18PA + (18PA * 1/4) = 22PA This hack takes full consideration of equipment.

Patch.name: Undead Revival Chance
Patch.Description:
Chance that undead units will revive once their death counter reaches 0 and 100CT. The chance formula is: (X - 32768) / 32767; meaning that the range is from 0x0000 (0 or 0%) down to 0x8000 (-32768 or 100%). In vanilla, the undead have 50% chance to revive. This hack's default value is 100% revival rate.
Examples: 0% revive: 0000 5% revive: F999 10% revive: F333 25% revive: E000 33.3% revive: D555 50% revive: C000 75% revive: A000 100% revive: 8000

Patch.name: Weapon Strike Fix (Version 1)
Patch.Description: In FFTP, If the Blank Box under Hit Allies are checked for that ability as well as 'Weapon Strike' The ability will ignore the weapon's elemental and only take elemental damage from the ability. Else, it will stack the elemental damage from bothe the weapon and the ability.
